just look spend a little bit of the time talking about DynamoDB as you heard DynamoDB is our key value and document
store for high scale workloads it gives you a performance in the single
millisecond response time range regardless of your data size it's fully
managed so you just create a table and you go when you have large data sizes
with unbounded size you don't know what it's gonna get to and you need key value and need fast response dynamodb is a
really a great choice of a database for those workloads and the fact that it's
fully managed makes it really easy and developers have an array of a language SDKs to choose from so if you're writing
in a node or Java or whatever language that you choose from dynamo works pretty
well for you so we were here last year at reinvent and we we caught all kinds
of feedback from our customers and so we took the feedback went back to our offices and started working on it and
the over the last 12 months we've doing a lot of work in dynamo to meet some of the new requirements for our
customers so we've done a lot of work in
our adaptive capacity so as I said dynamo is a fully managed database and
so it manages capacity for you all the time you you know you start using the table and your throughput goes up your
application is doing work dynamo do you really can can scale up can scale down to meet the demands of your application
so in june we introduced this thing
called Auto scale basically you create a table Auto scale is on by default and then you basically set it and forget it
and as the demands of your application goes up dynamo scales up as the demands
of the application comes down dynamic scales down so basically you pay for what you really need with respect of
capacity and you really don't have to spend too much time managing capacity we also introduced this thing called time
to live which is a TTL where you can set expiry time for items in the database so
if you have tables that are infinitely growing and you get to a point where you think that you really don't need data
from five years ago you can set it TTL and data will automatically expire in
the background for you so you can shrink your tables and and and save on your storage costs or you can keep the data
forever your choice we introduced VP C so that you can include DynamoDB tables
in your Virtual Private Networks for better security and as you may know
dynamo is also integrates with a SS aim so you can have fine-grained access control so now with VP C and
fine-grained access control you get a very good set of capabilities for managing the security of your tables we
also introduced Dax which is the DynamoDB accelerator it's a caching mechanism it's fully integrated
into dynamo DB and one of the nice things about it is it you don't actually have to be fully aware that there is a
cash sitting in front of the database because you basically point your application to Dax and all the rights go
through the cash and all the reads come from the cash and with that you can get microsecond response times because it's
an in-memory store for for dynamo so if you need caching to to meet the demands
of really high read rates Dax is really good for that so that's the stuff that's
already been introduced over the last few months and as you heard today view
announced global tables and again this is in response to a lot of our customers who are building applications to to
interface with their customers many of our customers are our building application with a global footprint so
as Shaun was talking about somebody like Expedia I mean their customers are all
over the planet so where do you serve them from with global tables it's really easy as Joe showed you can create a
table you can with a few clicks you select the regions that you want to replicate to and of course this is
really important because it's the regions of your choice so you know if you don't want the data to be in a
particular region you just don't choose that region and you can build applications for if you have this
globally dispersed user base where everybody can read and write from where they are and dynamo is really truly the
first multi master and multi region database because your rights are done
locally they're not routed to some primary or some master someplace on the globe where then everything gets
replicated from we actually do reads and writes locally and dynamodb in the background will take care of all the
replication back and forth you get low latency for reads and writes and in
addition if you really are the type that needs belts and suspenders for your disaster recovery now you can globally
replicate so if you want to keep a copy of your data in a different continent for safety and insecurity you can do
